title: Pasta With Slow-Cooker Pork Ragù
directions: In a 4- to 6-quart slow cooker, combine the carrot, onion, garlic, tomato paste, thyme, oregano, ¾ teaspoon salt, and ¼ teaspoon pepper. Add the tomatoes (and their juices); add the pork and turn to coat.
Cover and cook until the pork is very tender, on low for 7 to 8 hours or on high for 5 to 6 hours (this will shorten total recipe time).
Separately, cook the fettuccine according to the package directions.
Shred the pork and mix it into the cooking liquid. Toss the pasta with the ragù and sprinkle with the Parmesan
ingredients: 1 1/2 pounds boneless pork shoulder or butt, trimmed and cut in half
